original_title: Sri Lanka’s Bank of Ceylon announces debenture issue basis of allotment
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Bank of Ceylon said investors who have applied up to and inclusive of 20,000,000 Type A Debentures will be allotted 100% of debentures applied.

Bank of Ceylon had an initial issue of 50 million Basel III compliant tier 2 listed rated unsecured subordinated redeemable 5-year debentures with non-viability write down features at an issue price of LKR 100 each.
The bank said this was to raise a sum of up to LKR5bn; with an option to issue a further 50 million debentures to increase a further LKR5bn, in the event of an oversubscription of the initial issue.
“We write to inform that the Bank has received applications only for Type A Debentures, (ie 15% pa fixed rate) from resident qualified investors,” the banks said in a stock exchange filing.

“Investors who have applied over and above 20,000,000 Type A Debentures will be allotted 20,000,000 Debentures plus 99.71% of any balance unallotted application amount rounded to the nearest 100 Debentures.” (Colombo/Dec 28/2023)
